taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Heliantheae;subtribe Madiinae;genus Madia;species citrigracilis;

bio:treatment.discussion: Madia citrigracilis occurs in northeastern California and northern Nevada. Small or young plants can be exceedingly difficult to distinguish morphologically from M. gracilis, which is one of two putative parental species suggested by J. Clausen et al. (1945) to have been involved in the hybrid (allopolyploid) origin of M. citrigracilis. Molecular data reinforce Clausen et al.â€™s hypothesis that M. citrigracilis is evolutionarily distinct from M. gracilis.
